title: Chicken Enchiladas with Creamy Green Chile Sauce

Ingredients.3: 3  cooked boneless skinless chicken breast halves, shredded

Ingredients.4: 12 ounces shredded Monterey Jack cheese, divided

Ingredients.10: 1 (4 ounce) can chopped green chiles, drained

Directions.1: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.

Directions.2: Heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Fry tortillas (1 at a time) for 5 seconds on each side to soften and make them pliable. Add more oil to pan as needed. Drain between layers of paper towel and keep warm.

Directions.3: Divide chicken, 10 ounces of Monterey Jack cheese, and onion among the 12 tortillas. Roll up each tortilla and place seam-side down in the prepared pan.

Directions.4: Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add flour and whisk until mixture begins to boil. Slowly add broth, stirring with a whisk until thickened. Mix in the sour cream and chiles, heating thoroughly but do not boil, stirring occasionally. Pour mixture over the enchiladas.

Directions.5: Bake in the preheated oven until bubbly and heated through, about 20 minutes. Top with remaining Monterey Jack cheese and bake for 5 more minutes. Garnish with chopped green onions and cilantro.
